PaperTitle: Revisiting the Modifiable Areal Unit Problem in Deep Traffic Prediction with Visual Analytics

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Loads two-month (59 days) taxi transaction data from Shenzhen, consisting of about 47 million records, including taxi IDs, prices, mileage, positions, and times.
Inputs: Raw taxi transaction data (ID, price, mileage, get-on/off positions, get-on/off times)
Outputs: Cleaned and structured taxi movement records
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1 Input Dataset: The data record taxi transactions made by over 20k taxis during the period from 1 Jan. 2019 to 28 Feb. 2019 (59 days).

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Loads TAZ data delineated by Shenzhen transportation officials, consisting of 1066 zones of varying size for partitioning traffic data.
Outputs: Spatial partitioning scheme for traffic regions (TAZs)
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1 Input Dataset: This work leverages TAZs of 1066 zones delineated by Shenzhen transportation officials.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Partitions the study area into two shapes (grid and TAZ) and three scales (50x25, 100x50, 200x100) for traffic aggregation, with TAZs rasterized into fixed-size grids.
Outputs: Partitioned datasets by shape and scale, suitable for neural network input
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Data Preprocessing: To explore the shaping effect, two partition shapes are tested: grids and TAZs.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Aggregates traffic records by region and time slot, rasterizing TAZs into fixed-size matrices for ST-ResNet consumption.
Outputs: Raster matrices representing traffic movements over time and space
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Data Preprocessing: The process is to convert TAZ-based traffic aggregations Xrt into a raster matrix Xgt âˆˆ Rwxh.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Trains six ST-ResNet models on grid and TAZ partitions of varying scales, modeling temporal dependencies (trend, period, closeness) in traffic data.
Outputs: Predicted traffic matrices for testing data
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2 Data Preprocessing: ST-ResNet is designed to consume a sequence of fixed-sized matrices.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Computes prediction accuracy metrics (PRMSE, Uncertainty Coefficient U, and Correlation Coefficient CORR) at the regional level to support multi-scale comparisons.
Outputs: Metrics for model evaluation across scales and regions
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.3 Scale-Independent Evaluation Metrics: We select three metrics satisfying this requirement: percentage RMSE (PRMSE), uncertainty coefficient (U), and correlation coefficient (CORR).

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays spatial distributions of traffic volumes and prediction errors using a bivariate choropleth map with a value-suppressing uncertainty palette (VSUP).
Outputs: Interactive bivariate choropleth map showing spatial variation and uncertainty
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.1 Bivariate Map: We design Bivariate Map to support spatial variation exploration (T.1).

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Visualizes spatial autocorrelation of traffic volumes and prediction errors at regional and local tract levels, supporting spatial association analysis.
Outputs: Scatter plot showing spatial association of traffic data
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.2 Moran's I Scatterplot: The Moran's I Scatterplot is designed to reveal the spatial autocorrelation of traffic volumes in each grid-based partition and local tract (T.2).

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Presents scale-independent metrics across different scales and regions using nonlinear dot plots in a tree layout, facilitating comparison of uncertainties and errors.
Outputs: Nonlinear dot plots for multi-scale metric comparisons
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.3 Multi-scale Attribution View: The view adopts the idea of nonlinear dot plot [31] to encode each region as a dot.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays temporal variations of traffic volumes and prediction errors for selected partitions over time slots using a heatmap.
Outputs: Heatmap view showing traffic and error variations over time for selected regions
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.1 Bivariate Map: Variations of traffic volumes and prediction errors over all testing time slots (7 daysx48 slots/day) are presented as a heatmap (Fig. 5(b)).

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Allows users to select individual data points or regions using point or lasso tools, linking selections across views for detailed exploration and filtering.
Outputs: Highlighted data points and updated views (map, scatterplot, dot plot)
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.4 User Interactions: Users can select a specific data point of interest with Point selection tool, or filter a subset of data points with Rect or Lasso tools.

Outputs: Highlighted data points and updated views (map, scatterplot, dot plot)
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.4 User Interactions: Users can select a specific data point of interest with Point selection tool, or filter a subset of data points with Rect or Lasso tools.

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Allows users to switch between different partition shapes (Grid or TAZ) for spatial analysis and visualization.
Outputs: Updated partitioned datasets and refreshed visualization views
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.4 User Interactions: First, the interface includes widgets to explore partition scales (50x25, 100x50, and 200x100) and shapes (grid and TAZ).

Outputs: Updated partitioned datasets and refreshed visualization views
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.4 User Interactions: First, the interface includes widgets to explore partition scales (50x25, 100x50, and 200x100) and shapes (grid and TAZ).
